byline.contributor: The New York Times contributed reporting.

abstract: Nan Tucker McEvoy, the last member of the founding family to head the San Francisco Chronicle, chairwoman of Chronicle Publishing and a prominent California olive rancher, dies at age 95.
lead_paragraph: A member of The Chronicle’s founding family, Ms. McEvoy was the chairwoman of Chronicle Publishing, which included The Chronicle, a morning daily and other media holdings, from 1981 to 1995.

headline.main: Nan Tucker McEvoy, Heiress Who Ran San Francisco Chronicle, Dies at 95
headline.print_headline: Nan Tucker McEvoy, 95; Ran The San Francisco Chronicle

snippet: A member of The Chronicle’s founding family, Ms. McEvoy was the chairwoman of Chronicle Publishing, which included The Chronicle, a morning daily and other media holdings, from 1981 to 1995.
